description: Indulge in the creamy, cheesy goodness of Cheesy Funeral Potatoes, a beloved dish that brings comfort and joy to any gathering. Perfectly baked and irresistibly delicious, this dish will have everyone asking for seconds!
instructions: In a large bowl, combine the frozen hash browns, sour cream, cream of chicken soup, 1 1/2 cups of cheddar cheese, melted butter, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Mix until well combined and transfer to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
Sprinkle the remaining cheddar cheese and crushed cornflakes on top.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown.
tips: For an extra layer of flavor, consider adding cooked bacon bits or green onions to the mixture before baking.

structured_content.content: Cheesy Funeral Potatoes are a classic comfort food that combines creamy textures and rich flavors, making them a staple at holiday gatherings and potlucks. This dish is not only easy to prepare but also brings a sense of nostalgia, reminding many of family get-togethers and celebrations.

structured_content.content: This dish holds a special place in my heart as it was always present at family reunions. The creamy, cheesy layers remind me of laughter and love shared around the dinner table.

• Main ingredient: Frozen hash browns work best for a quick prep and consistent texture.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Garlic and onion powder add depth to the dish.
  • Supporting ingredients: Sour cream and cream of chicken soup create a rich, creamy base.
  • Equipment needed: A large mixing bowl and a 9x13 inch baking dish are essential for this recipe.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix thoroughly. Preheat the oven while you prepare the dish.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, top with cheese and cornflakes, and bake until golden brown.
Finishing Touches:
Let it cool slightly before serving to allow the flavors to meld.

upload.context: A visual representation of the cooking process in the oven.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Bake until the top is golden brown for the best texture.
  • Avoid overmixing to keep the hash browns intact.
  • Look for bubbling edges to indicate doneness.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge and reheat in the oven for best results.
